availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Elizabethtown, Kentucky attorney and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Joseph McCulloch and Nancy McCulloch. Farmer in Holmes County, Ohio, in 1850. Attorney in Hardin County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from October 3, 1861 to December 31, 1862. Killed in action at the Battle of Stone's River on December 31, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Holmes County, Berlin, p. 192A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Elizabethtown, p. 186.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 56.
